text: Gitte Munch Larsen is a Danish curler. She is a . ==Teams== ===Women's=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! scope="col"| Season ! scope="col"| Skip ! scope="col"| Third ! scope="col"| Second ! scope="col"| Lead ! scope="col"| Alternate ! scope="col"| Events |- ! scope="row" rowspan=2| 1989–90 | Helena Blach || Malene Krause || Hanne Raun || Gitte Larsen || || (4th) |- | Helena Blach || Malene Krause || Lone Kristoffersen || Gitte Larsen || || DWCC 1990 |- ! scope="row"| 1990–91 | Helena Blach || Malene Krause || Lone Kristoffersen || Gitte Larsen || Lene Bidstrup (WCC) || (5th) DWCC 1991 (6th) |} ===Mixed=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! scope="col"| Season ! scope="col"| Skip ! scope="col"| Third ! scope="col"| Second ! scope="col"| Lead ! scope="col"| Events |- ! scope="row"| 2001 | Gert Larsen || Nete Larsen || Mikkel Krause || Gitte Larsen || DMxCC 2001 DM Mix | Hvidovre Curling Club |} ==Private life== Gitte Larsen is a member of a big family of Danish curlers. Her husband Kim Dupont competed at the 1980 and 1981 World Junior Curling Championships. Their son Oliver Dupont is a ; his wife Victoria Moiseeva is a Russian curler, and . Daughter Denise, has competed at the 2006 and 2010 Olympics, as well as nine World Championships. Their other daughter, Madeleine, competed at the 2010 Olympics, and won the Frances Brodie Award in 2004. ==References== ==External links== * * * Category:Living people Category:People from Hvidovre Municipality Category:Danish female curlers Category:Danish curling champions Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
